items.description: MI posture sequence framework (Engaging/Focusing/Evoking/Planning) is the structural foundation of the campfire conversation (D5 resolution) but exists nowhere in the library. Only found in issue #593 comments and provenance log.
items.detail: Create a new card or add a major HOW section to Component - Campfire documenting the MI posture sequence, OARS moves, Me/You/Us relational arc, and stage-matched pacing. This is the most critical gap for prompt writing -- without it, the prompt writer must reconstruct the framework from issue comments.

items.description: 6-field campfire scorecard schema (startingState, heavyThing, firstProjectSeed, allianceAgreement, capacitySignals, valueSignals) is the primary output of the campfire conversation (D6 resolution) but is not documented in any library card.
items.detail: The scorecard schema should be documented in Component - Campfire or as a standalone artifact/standard. It defines the handoff contract between campfire and all downstream agents. All agents read this scorecard before their first interaction.

items.description: Bordin Working Alliance exit criteria (goals, tasks, bond) determine when the campfire conversation can transition to the walk invitation. Not documented in any library card.
items.detail: Add to Component - Campfire HOW section or Agent - Jarvis HOW section. These criteria are the prompt's success test for conversation completion.

items.description: Principle - Agreement Over Expectation is referenced in D5 and D6 resolutions as the governing principle for reflected extraction and the alliance agreement, but no such card exists in the library.
items.detail: Create Principle - Agreement Over Expectation in docs/context-library/rationale/principles/. This principle governs how Jarvis forms working agreements with builders -- through mutual conversation, not system defaults.

items.description: The HOW section contains a rigid 8-step sequence that predates the D5 resolution (2026-02-18). It does not mention MI posture sequence, OARS, reflected extraction, scorecard, or Bordin exit criteria. The entire HOW section needs rewriting to reflect D5/D6.
items.detail: Rewrite the HOW section to describe the MI posture sequence, OARS moves, reflected extraction mechanism, scorecard output, and how the walk invitation emerges from Bordin criteria. The existing 8-step sequence can be preserved as a simplified summary but should not be the primary structural description.

items.description: WHEN section was last updated 2026-02-12, before D5 (2026-02-18) and D6 (2026-02-18). No History entries for D5 or D6. Reality note is stale.
items.detail: Add D5 and D6 History entries to the WHEN section. Update reality note to reference the resolved decisions.

items.description: D5 and D6 are still presented as OPEN decision questions in the card body. Both were resolved 2026-02-18. The card body has not been updated with resolutions.
items.detail: Add resolution blocks to D5 and D6 sections in the Release card matching the format of D1-D4 (which do have resolution blocks). This is the highest-priority staleness fix -- the Release card is the primary reference for build planning.

items.description: WHEN section was last updated 2026-02-12, before D5/D6. No History entries. The HOW phases table predates D5 but is broadly compatible. Missing explicit connection to MI posture sequence.
items.detail: Add D5/D6 History entries. Note that The Meeting phase maps to MI Engaging and The Walk spans Focusing/Evoking/Planning.

items.description: WHEN section still says 'Depends on campfire story decisions (D5) for initial prompt design' as if D5 is unresolved. D5 was resolved 2026-02-18.
items.detail: Add D5 and D6 History entries. Update reality note to reflect that D5 and D6 are resolved and the campfire prompt design framework is now defined.

items.description: Day 1 goals still say 'Warm greeting at Campfire (Mesa)'. D5 resolved: Jarvis conducts onboarding, not Mesa.
items.detail: Change 'Mesa' to 'Jarvis' in Day 1 goals. Mesa is reserve status (D4 resolution). Jarvis is the first steward the builder meets.

items.description: Day 1 table still says Actor is 'Mesa at Campfire' for warm greeting step. D5 resolved: Jarvis conducts onboarding.
items.detail: Change 'Mesa at Campfire' to 'Jarvis at Campfire' in Day 1 step table. Update related conformance tests.

items.description: WHERE section lists 'Agent - Mesa (first contact)'. D5 resolved: Jarvis is first contact. Mesa is reserve status.
items.detail: Change Agent - Mesa (first contact) to Agent - Jarvis (first contact) in the WHERE section. Update transition table similarly.

items.description: Agent - Jarvis card does not reference Component - Campfire in its WHERE section, despite the campfire being the first place Jarvis appears. The card only lists Room - Council Chamber as home.
items.detail: Add '[[Component - Campfire]] -- conducts onboarding conversation' to Agent - Jarvis WHERE section.

items.description: Component - Campfire does not reference the scorecard output or the downstream consumers (Agent - Marvin, Agent - Conan, etc.) who read the scorecard.
items.detail: Add scorecard output and downstream consumer links to Component - Campfire WHERE section once the scorecard schema is documented.

items.description: WHEN section still says 'Depends on campfire story decisions (D5) for initial prompt design' -- D5 was resolved 2026-02-18. Has D2 History but not D5/D6 History entries. Minor residual staleness.
items.detail: Add D5 and D6 History entries to Agent - Jarvis WHEN section. Update reality note to remove the D5 dependency language. Low priority because the Agent card describes the agent in general, not the campfire prompt specifically.

items.description: Component - Campfire HOW section now has the MI posture sequence and OARS reference integrated into the 8-step sequence, which is a significant improvement over v1. However, OARS is mentioned in one sentence without elaboration, and Bordin exit criteria are described in one sentence. The framework references are name-drops rather than explanations.
items.detail: Expand the OARS and Bordin references with brief explanations of each component. Not blocking for prompt writing (the context briefing fills these gaps) but would improve the card's standalone utility for future reference.

items.description: The Library Patches table at the bottom of the Release card still lists 'Standard - Onboarding Sequence: References Mesa at campfire' as Pending. The Standard card now says 'Jarvis at Campfire' -- the patch has been applied but the Release card's patch tracking table has not been updated to reflect this.
items.detail: Update the Library Patches table status for Standard - Onboarding Sequence from 'Pending' to 'Patched' or add a date.

items.description: Agent - Jarvis WHERE section still does not reference Component - Campfire, despite the campfire being the first and most important place Jarvis appears in R1. This was flagged in v1 feedback and has not been addressed.
items.detail: Add '[[Component - Campfire]] -- conducts onboarding conversation' to Agent - Jarvis WHERE section. The campfire IS the first Jarvis experience.

items.description: No library card documents the campfire-to-Marvin handoff mechanism in detail. The Release card mentions it, the scorecard fields are named, but the actual handoff contract (what data format, how Marvin receives it, what Marvin does first) is not specified.
items.detail: When the LiveStore event schema is designed for builder.onboardingCompleted, create a Standard or update Component - Campfire to document the handoff contract. Low priority now -- needed at MAKE time, not PROTOTYPE time.

items.description: No card describes the system planting workflow -- the UX flow for transitioning a completed Silver project into a planted system. The concept is described across Primitive - System, Agent - Marvin, and Release - Planting Season but the actual interaction pattern (modal? wizard? inline?) is not specified.
items.detail: Consider creating a Capability card (e.g., Capability - System Planting) or expanding the HOW section of Primitive - System to describe the planting UX flow. This is needed before R3 implementation begins.

items.description: No card describes the recurring task generation engine -- how systems generate tasks on cadence. The Primitive - System card specifies that systems have patterns and generate tasks, but the mechanism (cron-like scheduler, event-sourced timer, LiveStore materializer) is not documented.
items.detail: Consider adding a System card (e.g., System - Task Generation) or expanding Primitive - System HOW section with implementation guidance for the generation engine.

items.description: No card specifies the system health computation algorithm. Standard - Smoke Signal Thresholds defines thresholds (Yellow: <80%, Red: <50%) but not how cycle completion percentage is computed (rolling window? calendar-aligned? weighted by recency?).
items.detail: Expand Standard - Smoke Signal Thresholds HOW section to specify the computation method for cycle completion percentage, or add a dedicated standard for system health metrics.

items.description: Staleness threshold diverges between Release - Planting Season (14 days) and Standard - Smoke Signal Thresholds (3 weeks / 21 days) for active projects. The standard and the release card disagree on the trigger threshold.
items.detail: Reconcile the staleness threshold. Release - Planting Season says 14+ days; Standard - Smoke Signal Thresholds says 3 weeks. The Release card is the authority for MVP scope, but the Standard should either match or explicitly note the R3 override.

items.description: No decision record addresses whether systems share the same one-per-hex placement model as projects. D3 resolved one project per hex but did not address systems.
items.detail: A decision record or update to D3 should clarify system hex placement. Likely answer: systems also get one per hex, but this should be explicit.

items.description: Primitive - System does not link to Room - Drafting Room despite the Drafting Room being where systems are configured (via Agent - Marvin Stage 3). The reverse link exists (Room - Drafting Room -> Primitive - System) but not the forward link.
items.detail: Add '[[Room - Drafting Room]] -- system configuration during Silver project creation' to Primitive - System WHERE section.

items.description: No card specifies the exact UX for the 'Project or System' entity type choice in the Drafting Room. The creation pathway is documented (3-stage system flow) but the interaction pattern for the initial choice (toggle? card selection? Marvin question?) is not specified anywhere.
items.detail: Expand Room - Drafting Room HOW section or Primitive - System HOW section to describe the entity type selection UX. The choice moment is the first user-facing decision in system creation and needs design guidance.

items.description: Recurring task generation engine mechanism remains unspecified. Primitive - System says 'Technical implementation details are left to the development team.' No card provides implementation guidance for the generation mechanism.
items.detail: Consider a System card or technical standard for how task generation works. The product cards correctly describe WHAT happens but not HOW the engine works.

items.description: System health computation algorithm needs engineering design. Standard - Smoke Signal Thresholds now correctly defines health as snapshot-of-right-now with qualitative thresholds (Yellow = current cycle has overdue items, Red = significantly behind). However, the quantitative computation ('what constitutes a current cycle', 'how many overdue items trigger Yellow') still needs engineering decision.
items.detail: This is expected for a product library -- the quantitative algorithm is an engineering decision. The library provides sufficient qualitative guidance. No card creation needed, but builders should document the algorithm once designed.

items.description: No explicit decision record confirms systems share the one-per-hex model with projects. D3 only addresses projects. Primitive - System card now states it explicitly but no D-issue covers it.
items.detail: Low priority. The Primitive - System card is sufficiently clear. A formal decision record would be nice for provenance but is not blocking.
